meanings.definition: A person or thing that whirls.
meanings.sent1: The children watched the colorful whirlers at the playground.
meanings.sent2: The windmill was one of the most famous whirlers in the town.
meanings.sent3: The whirlers on the merry-go-round made the kids giggle with delight.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were like whirlers, spinning around in her mind.
meanings.sent5: The whirlers in the tornado were a terrifying sight.

meanings.sent1: The whirlers on the ceiling fan kept the room cool.
meanings.sent2: The colorful whirlers on the toy top fascinated the child.
meanings.sent3: The whirlers of the windmill spun gracefully in the breeze.
meanings.sent4: The whirlers of the carousel added a touch of magic to the fair.
meanings.sent5: The whirlers of the hurricane caused widespread destruction.

meanings.definition: A dancer who performs spinning movements.
meanings.sent1: The ballet performance featured talented whirlers in beautiful costumes.
meanings.sent2: The whirlers in the dance troupe amazed the audience with their skill.
meanings.sent3: The whirlers in the competition spun faster than anyone expected.
meanings.sent4: She moved across the stage like a graceful whirler in a music box.
meanings.sent5: The whirler's spins were so fast, they blurred into a mesmerizing dance.
